file_content.text: The scans are good. Some day, we'll take this factory.
You're alive! And not only that, my comlink is picking up signals again. Is everything uploaded?
That network should be choking on malicious programs.
All viruses are in.
It wasn't so bad.
It's done, but I found out firsthand why the Empire hasn't taken that factory.
Those droids nearly killed me!
Now it's my turn. I'll aim our scanners at the Okara Droid Factory to measure the extent of the damage the viruses caused.
If the computer core shuts the probes down, I can record how long a window that creates for future assaults.
I'll leave you to it.
I'll go now.
Would it matter if I told you to go back to base and get medical attention?
Then get help, okay?
Sure, and I will. Their anti-air defenses should be compromised, so I'll creep out of here when it's safe.
Still deranged, I see.
Ha! No, scanning from here is no risk compared to what you just did. I'll find a secure spot and call a medical ship soon.
I cannot express what your success will mean. Not to me--I'm nothing--but to the families of the men who died for this mission.
Those soldiers did not fail their Empire, nor did their Empire fail them.
You go. I've got to disinfect this plasma burn.
Get down! The droid patrols will spot you.
Apologies for shouting, my lord. But if they find one of us, they'll find all of us.
Sorry to be jumpy, but if they find one of us, they'll find all of us.
I'm Lieutenant Rutau, Fifth Infantry, Second Battalion, Besh Company. I'd say First Platoon, but there isn't one anymore.
Military intelligence not do its job?
Ran into unexpected trouble?
It wasn't worse than most of the recon we get. We were going for the Okara factory to upload viruses.
Sole survivors are either cowards or fighters. Which are you?
Was it your fault?
If I fought any less hard, I'd be with the rest of them, my lord. Ask this wreckage here.
I see you gave as good as you got.
I see droid wreckage, too.
It was a total loss on both sides. Our platoon was headed to the Okara Droid Factory to upload viruses.
Your passions are evident on your face.
I see you know pain, then.
Yeah well, I shot so many droids I went numb, but I'm here and the one that got me is wreckage.
Major Tyrus sent me to find your platoon. What happened?
I've been searching for you.
A slaughter. We were on our way to upload viruses into the network of the Okara Droid Factory.
A probe spotted us, and pretty soon, battle droids had us surrounded.
Your ankle is charred down to the bone. You need a medevac out of here.
You look injured.
Oh, that. I knocked over a droid, and he shot me from the ground while I was slagging the others. That faceless one there is him.
It's one of the many droid patrols from the Okara factory. They spotted us uploading a virus, surrounded us... it was ruthless.
Droids aren't like people. They don't retreat. They don't accept surrender. They just keep exterminating. So now it's up to me.
How can you succeed where a platoon failed?
You expect to do this alone?
It's an acceptable risk. I'm not worth more than any of the rest who died here. I'm just luckier.
And me. Right?
No, no, I can shoot and move. I think some of the bone is still intact.
You're wounded and alone. You're asking to get killed.
That's beyond stupid.
Pain is in the mind. This ankle looks bad, but it's not an essential bone. The mission is what matters.
If I can ambush enough patrols of battle droids, I can upload my packets and run before my painkiller wears off.
What else can I do? I'm not going to ask you to go where I wouldn't.
Your courage is admirable, but unnecessary. Give me the viruses.
Brave, but I'm more suited.
Hmm, you do have a maneuverability advantage... if you're keen to do it, I guess that's best.
If you refuse assistance, then your fate is your own.
You're an idiot. Stay here.
If you're going to insist, I'll do just that. Good luck.
I go into trouble frequently.
Ha! I've had sergeants like you. Promoted every one.
Here are the virus packets. Your targets are the probe droids that travel with patrol escorts of battle droids.
Destroy the battle droids, then use this security spike to crack the probes. They'll upload the viruses right into their network.
This is my hiding spot. Not yours.
Our gunners brought some weaponry for dealing with droids. I should have given it to you in the first place.
I have to admit, I thought you'd be finished. I'd completely forgotten something before you left and was kicking myself.
Take it anyway. Maybe it will serve you in the future.
I appreciate the sentiment.
Thank you.
I wish I could say it was the pain clouding my judgment, but there's no excuse for not properly arming you.
Better than nothing.
Keep your technology. My weapons are the Force and my will.
That's not necessary.
Your men relied on them and died. I will not make the same mistake.
That's not necessary.
I did fine with standard-issue tech. Keep it for the trip home.
That's not necessary.
Nice thought, but I've already got a working method. Keep it.
That's not necessary.
Okay. It certainly is impressive that you succeeded anyway.
